00022 #include <GisCommon.h>
00023 
00024 /// \brief
00025 /// GisXmlCharDataHandler is convenience class for reading XML element content.
00026 /// When GisXmlReader encounters the start of an element with simple content, an object
00027 /// of this class can be constructed and pushed onto the GisXmlReader's SAX handler 
00028 /// stack. When the end of the element is reached, the object will contain all of
00029 /// the element's content.
00030 class GisXmlCharDataHandler :
00031     public GisDisposable,
00032     public GisXmlSaxHandler
00033 {
00034 public:
00035     /// \brief
00036     /// Constructs a Char Data Handler.
00037     /// 
00038     /// \return
00039     /// Returns GisXmlCharDataHandler
00040     /// 
00041     GIS_API static GisXmlCharDataHandler* Create(void);
00042 
00043     /// \brief
00044     /// Gets the element content that has been read sofar. When the end of the
00045     /// element is reached, this will contain all of the element content.
00046     /// 
00047     /// \return
00048     /// Returns the element content.
00049     /// 
00050     GIS_API const GisString* GetString()
00051     {
00052         return(mString);
00053     }
00054 
00055 protected:
00056 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00057     GisXmlCharDataHandler(void);
00058     virtual ~GisXmlCharDataHandler(void);
00059 
00060     /// Overridden Sax Callback. Receives the next chunk of element content.
00061     virtual void XmlCharacters(GisXmlSaxContext*, GisString *chars);
00062 /// \endcond
00063 
00064 private:
00065     /// The element content read sofar
00066     GisStringP mString;
00067 
00068 };
00069 
00070 /// \brief
00071 /// GisXmlCharDataHandlerP is a GisPtr on GisXmlCharDataHandler, provided for convenience.
00072 typedef GisPtr<GisXmlCharDataHandler> GisXmlCharDataHandlerP;
00073 
00074 #endif
